conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model with visible wall height/thickness, interior volume, and an angled/isometric-like view.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and floor plane separation; good cutaway. Some geometry appears simplified with many curved/rounded partitions, reducing fidelity to rectilinear plan corners.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Major mismatch versus 2D plan: overall building footprint becomes irregular/curved instead of mostly rectangular; several internal walls/partitions do not align with the 2D plan's straight wall locations and proportions; adjacency/room boundaries appear altered.

interior_elements.notes: Beds/sofa and some bathroom elements are present, but kitchen/dining elements are not clearly represented as in the 2D plan (e.g., kitchen run and dining table placement). Some furniture-to-room assignments are plausible but not clearly matching the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with readable walls and openings; lighting generally supports visibility. Minor ambiguity due to similar wall/floor colors and simplified openings.

detected_errors.description: Overall footprint and internal partition geometry deviate strongly (curved/irregular walls) from the rectilinear 2D plan, affecting room proportions and wall alignment.
Doors/windows are not consistently placed or sized/oriented to match the 2D plan; some openings appear simplified or relocated.
Furniture set is incomplete/mismatched relative to the 2D plan (notably kitchen/dining), reducing inferred room identity matching.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway was produced, but the 3D layout shows substantial footprint and partition distortions compared to the original 2D floor plan.
